cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall/meander near or just inland before drifting slowly northeast toward the Texas-Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi/Port O'Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, MX; Storm-Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX; Storm-Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island with secondary impacts extending into southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (7%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; gale-force winds are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along southeast Louisiana including areas near Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Harvey could drop 5–10 inches across south-central and southeast Louisiana, producing localized flooding in the New Orleans area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas along the Gulf approaches; potential for isolated tornadoes in rainbands early next week.
